intro: Collaea trinervia, commonly known as the narrow-veined collaea, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in spring, attracting various pollinators. It typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils in open habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
